file_content.text: Whatever you want.
What? I thought you had a plan.
Don't tell me: you forgot where we're going? Come on, let's go.
Thanks for letting me stay on with your crew, Captain. I plan to be a very generous Queen to all my friends.
I can see we're gonna get along just fine, Your High Exaltedness.
Glad to hear it, Empress.
Don't start with that. Risha will do fine. For now.
Let's hope your planet is more valuable than your father's "lost riches". That was barely enough to keep me flying.
I'm counting on that.
You already spent everything? Remind me to keep you away from my royal treasury....
You could be generous right now. Move into my quarters. They're cozy.
[Flirt] How generous?
A man who describes his quarters as "cozy" really means he leaves dirty clothes on the floor.
That should cost you almost nothing. What about the rest of us?
You don't have friends.
I'm sure I'll think of something.
Every captain needs a good first mate. Corso doesn't know what it takes to run a starship, but I do.
Considering the light years you've been racking up, I suggest a hyperdrive overhaul and a sublight engine tune-up. Which do you want first?
The last thing we need is to get stranded in deep space. Keep my hyperdrive... hyper.
Work on the hyperdrive.
We're always in a hurry. See if you can squeeze some extra thrust from the engines.
Focus on the engines.
Consider it done. I'll be indispensable before you know it.
I didn't hire you to make ship repairs. I just need someone to clean the refresher.
You're my janitor.
So we're clear, I charge extra to clean up after a Wookiee. I love Bowdaar, but he sheds. A lot.
I've been thinking about the future a lot lately, and I had a funny realization. Every scenario I see, you're in it.
I guess that's only right, all things considered. But still--never thought I'd get this close to anyone.
That kind of talk makes me want to turn out the lights and put up a "do not disturb" sign.
[Flirt] Get closer.
It's funny you should mention that. I've been considering a related topic.
We've traveled a long way. If you had to do it again, would you change anything?
Do you have any regrets?
The harder the flight, the sweeter the landing. And we're still flying.
When I first met you, I hated your guts. You were bossy, manipulative--squatting on my ship. What a nightmare.
You used to repulse me.
You weren't any better. Rude, sarcastic, greedy, lecherous--you're lucky that's what I look for in a man.
When we take over Dubrillion, we'll need to start thinking about producing an heir.
I know we can't have children the traditional way, but I've heard about a planet called Kamino. Rumor has it the natives specialize in genetic engineering.
Maybe we can make little copies of us? What about a hybrid?
I can see the possibilities.
Let's not get fancy. Besides, combining our good looks would be unfair to the rest of the galaxy.
I say we find some nice orphans. Raise them as our own.
Let's adopt children.
Orphans? More than one? Somebody likes the idea of being a father.
I've always thought the galaxy needed more of me. You too, for that matter.
Sounds good to me.
Maybe more than one heir. That's how dynasties stay healthy, after all.
What do you say we blow up that bridge when we get to it? And no rush, either.
We'll never have fun again.
What are you so worried about? I'll be doing the hard part.
The more, the merrier. I'll put the little scoundrels to work building me a new ship.
Sounds good to me.
Great idea. Father taught me all about starships when I was growing up, and I turned out great.
Where in the world did you get the idea I'd be a responsible parent?
Me? A father? That's crazy.
I didn't say you were going to raise them. I'm not stupid.
Just think... someone with my intelligence and your reflexes? There's nothing that child couldn't accomplish. We owe it to Dubrillion.
Whatever happens, I promise any child of ours will have the best of everything.
I've never let myself get close to anyone, not even my friends from the old days.
Count Rineld may be my husband, but you're my family.
But you're more than a friend. You're the closest thing I have to family.
If I'm family, does that make me part of your noble bloodline? Will I get my own portrait displayed in the Dubrillion royal palace?
So am I royalty, too?
Of course. It'll be very tasteful. We'll hang it in the dungeon.
Does that make me part of your noble bloodline? Will I have to learn that crazy Dubrillion accent?
So am I royalty, too?
Don't worry about it. My first edict as queen will be to teach everyone on the planet how to speak proper Basic.
Right back at you, Risha.
I feel the same way.
In that case, I'm a little short on credits right now. Would you mind floating me a few thousand? Just until payday.
Can I borrow some money?
Did I say family? I meant moderately-valued business partner.
I don't know what the future holds for us, but I promise to always be there. Not just for you, but everyone you care about.
That's as mushy as I'm getting. Back to finding trouble!
Didn't think you could still surprise me, but proposing in front on Count Rineld? That was a whammy.
I wasn't sure if you were serious then. But I am now--and my answer's yes.
Whatever happens--however long it takes--when I'm finally queen of Dubrillion, you'll be my king.
I've been thinking... when I'm finally the queen of Dubrillion, I'm going to need a king.
Someone who'll look good next to me on the palace balcony, waving to the people.
I'm not sure I agree with Count Rineld that I need to marry a Dubrillion nobleman. What do you think?
It's about blasted time you came around. Do you have any idea how many beautiful women I turned away to have you?
I think I'm your king.
Call me vain, but I hope it was thousands.
You think the people of your world are ready for a non-human king?
Do your people like aliens?
We've had non-human royalty before. They were all assassinated... but I'll hire you better guards.
You think the people of your world are ready for a guy like me?
Will the people accept me?
No one's ready for you. That's what makes you perfect.
We'll have a royal wedding someday, but let's do something personal right now. I, Risha Drayen, take you as my future king.
I promise to be faithful and always apologize when I get snippy with you, except when you're wrong.
I'm not always right, sweetheart, but when have I ever been wrong?
Which is never.
Don't ruin this moment by forcing me to be honest.
As queen, I promise to keep you in the lifestyle to which you've become accustomed, plus ten to twenty percent depending on good behavior.
I'm a little fuzzy on this concept of "good." Can you provide some examples?
I need some clarification.
Just remember I'm in charge and everything will be fine.
I promise to always let you believe you're the boss. Are we married yet?
Whatever works for you.
Whatever you say, sweetheart. Need me to fetch your crown for you?
It's a deal.
We're equal partners. You wouldn't last ten seconds without me.
Don't be ridiculous.
Alright, alright--shut up and come here.
I accept all your terms. Can we be married, already?
Fine, fine--just say "I do."
Yes.
You know better than to underbid me. Make it thirty to sixty percent, and you've got a deal.
Thirty percent is my minimum.
Done--but for that kind of money, I expect seriously good behavior.
What you said, plus this: I'll never skim more than ten percent off the royal treasury.
I promise things, too.
Only ten percent? You really do love me.
We don't need vows. I'm crazy for you, you're crazy for me. Let's be crazy together.
Let's skip the formalities.
That works, too. Come here....
What do you say we make this even more official?
So... how does it feel to be married?
I think you've been holding back on me until now.
Better than I expected.
You might be right.
Come to my quarters this time. I've made some... modifications for you.
[Flirt] Let me show you.
How can I resist that offer?
You never told me you were an engineering genius. I'm staying in the captain's quarters, from now on.
What we did won't hold up in a court of law. Don't start thinking you're co-captain of this ship.
We're not really married.
Congratulations, you just set a record for shortest honeymoon ever.
It occurs to me that with the Voidwolf dead, we've run out of trouble. Let's go make more.
Just because we're married doesn't mean we can settle down. We've still got lots of people trying to kill us.
Risha, I'm not the settling down type. Can you really see me sitting around with a crown on my head?
I don't want to marry you.
For about five minutes. Then you'd steal the royal treasury and flee.
You're right. This'll never work. Where does that leave us?
Who says the queen has to be married? To the void with tradition. Let's make our own rules.
We're special friends.
The best of both worlds, huh? It's worth a try.
Put me in charge of your defense fleet. I'll protect your planet and beat up pirates. That's a good living.
Make me an admiral.
Even better, you don't have to share power. Just keep a warm place for me whenever I'm on shore leave.
I thought I had a talent for negotiation. Sold... Admiral.
We won't get married. We'll just be... extremely close acquaintances.
Why don't you give up this queen nonsense and stay with me?
Forget about Dubrillion.
And be what, your first mate? I need a future of my own.
If you're not ready to settle down I won't force you--but someday I'll have to leave this ship and become queen of Dubrillion.
When that day comes, I hope you're ready to come with me.
I've been getting reports on the war for Dubrillion. It's dragging into a stalemate. Nobody has a clear advantage yet.
I want to get more involved in the war effort, but my allies tell me the best thing I can be is a symbol.
Don't listen to those people. If you want to fight for your planet, just do it.
Control your own destiny.
Problem is, they're right. I'm a hundred times more effective as a rallying point for people who oppose the king.
What are you supposed to represent?
A symbol of what?
I don't know... some nonsense about new hope.
Stay out of the war until it's over. Then you can swoop in and claim credit for the big victory.
Keep a low profile, for now.
Are you auditioning to be my political advisor? 'Cause you're doing a great job.
The minute I open my mouth and start talking politics, I risk losing support. I can't afford that right now.
Guess I'm stuck on the sidelines until it's over. At least I have company.
Things on Dubrillion have taken a turn. The king put a death mark on Count Rineld's head. When the citizens heard that, they rebelled.
The king imposed martial law to stop the rioting, but that got the aristocracy riled up. The whole planet's going to war.
Sounds like the count's plan to avoid bloodshed by marrying you just went up in flames.
This changes everything.
We were never going to unseat the king without a fight. I just hoped we'd pick the time and place.
Where do the other nobles stand? Are they with the count, or the king?
What do the aristocrats want?
Some support Count Rineld. Others remain loyal to the king. They're all looking to benefit from the fight.
It's a lot easier to steal a throne when everyone's busy fighting.
Good. It makes our job easier.
Yes, that's worked out so well for Alderaan.
Needless to say, the count has his hands full just staying alive. But even with all that's happened, he still wants to marry me.
I can't keep putting him off. Any advice how I should play this?
A death mark puts a lot of pressure on a person. If you're going to let him down, be gentle.
Be careful.
What do you mean "if?" I'm with you now, remember?
There's no good way to shoot a man down--especially one who's running for his life.
You can't marry the count. You're spending the rest of your life with me.
[Flirt] Marry me, Risha.
What? I asked you for advice, not... do you really mean that?
Forget about the politics for a second. Do you love this guy or not?
Do you want to marry him?
I barely know him. This isn't about love. I need to figure out what's best for my long-term plans.
Is there a dowry if I give you away to him? Not that it would affect my recommendation....
Can I profit from this?
Why am I not surprised the word "dowry" exists in your vocabulary?
Oh, perfect--time's up. That's him calling on the holo. Alright, let's do this.
Merritt, I'm glad you're safe. From what I hear, the fighting got worse after you escaped.
I cannot spare Dubrillion from war, but perhaps we can still create a better future together.
I realize forging a true relationship takes time, and our marriage won't be consummated for some time. But I am hopeful.
My proposal stands, dear Risha. Will you marry me?
This man could be dead tomorrow. Even if he lives, who knows what the politics of Dubrillion will be like when the war ends?
You don't need him.
The best thing you can do is stay independent. It's always worked for me.
I'm sorry, Merritt. I can't marry you. The war doesn't change that.
C'mon, this is a no-brainer. Sure he's rich, handsome and popular. But I'm... me.
[Flirt] Stay with me.
I'm sorry Merritt, but I can't argue with logic like that. He's had my heart longer than you.
I'm sorry Merritt, but we'd never work out. What can I say? The captain's my man.
I'm sorry, Merritt, but he has a point. As scum of the galaxy goes, he's unique.
Count, could you excuse us for a minute?
String him along for a while.
The way I see it, this guy hasn't given you nearly enough gifts to tie you down forever.
I say you lead him on for a while and see just how serious he is about you.
I wasn't going to marry him anyway. I don't want to spend my honeymoon running for my life.
Merritt, I feel like we're rushing into things. We should take our time--for the good of Dubrillion.
You're absolutely right. Let us part as friends.
Say yes. Hurry, before you lose your nerve.
Go ahead and marry him.
What about us? I thought you wanted to marry me.
What about us? You're ready to throw all that away?
What about us? Are we over, just like that?
Sooner or later, we'd drive each other crazy. At least this way, we end as friends.
Splitting up now is better.
You are an honorable man. Risha?
You and the count are your world's best hope for peace. I won't stand in your way.
Dubrillion matters more.
A grand and noble gesture. I thank you. Risha?
That was a test to see if you'd do it. Of course I don't want you marrying the count! You're with me!
[Flirt] Don't marry him.
Sorry Merritt, but he's right. I've been with him for longer than I care to admit.
I hope we can still be friends. I'll need you to rebuild our world when the war ends.
Of course. I look forward to the day you grant me amnesty so I may return to Dubrillion.
Farewell, Risha. May the stars watch over you....
That ended better than I expected--except for that whole part with my world being at war.
You'll be Queen of Dubrillion someday.
Chin up, Risha.
I'll have my throne even if I have to build it myself.
You said no to the count's proposal, but I seem to recall you had a second offer on the table.
[Flirt] So... about us.
It's under consideration. I promise not to keep you waiting for long.
You're not having any regrets about turning down the count, are you?
Are you sure you're alright?
I've never regretted anything about my life. No reason to start now.
Sometimes people have to fight. My advice is, don't get caught in the middle.
That's Dubrillion's problem.
Isn't that exactly what you've spent your entire career doing?
That's enough politics and relationship issues for one day. Let's go steal something expensive. I always feel better after a good caper.
Yes. I'll marry you. We'll make it official the old-fashioned way. Have your people bring me a written contract to sign.
But let's not make it easy for the king to kill us. Until the war's over, we shouldn't meet in person. Agreed?
I will continue to send you updates as I'm able. Dubrillion will be free. Farewell, my lovely wife. May the stars watch over you....
Well. This is awkward.
You have a place on my ship for as long as you need it.
Don't worry about it.
Stop being so nice. You're making me regret all this.
And here I was hoping another man would finally take you off my hands.
To say the least.
If you were that eager to get rid of me, you would've spaced me by now.
What the count doesn't know won't hurt him.
[Flirt] It doesn't have to be.
Oh, no you don't. From now on, we're just friends.
Isn't he adorable?
He's not my type, but whatever floats your speeder.
If you say so.
You make an adorable couple. I hope you're not expecting a gift on this short notice...
Congratulations, Risha.
You can owe us.
That has to be the least romantic wedding I've ever seen in my life.
What, no honeymoon?
Maybe--but it's a perfect foundation for running a kingdom.
I should probably do something to celebrate. Want to go steal something really expensive?
I can't hold off Count Rineld forever. I have to answer his marriage proposal some day.
But I want to make an informed decision. I was hoping you could help me out with that. In private.
If I didn't know better, I'd say you were finally surrendering to my charms.
Are you flirting with me?
Let's not go that far yet. I still need convincing....
I have a lot to say on the subject. I recommend we lock your door, so our conversation isn't disturbed.
[Flirt] Gladly.
You think of everything.
That was a very persuasive argument.
Sweetheart, this debate's just getting started.
[Flirt] I'm not done yet.
You've put some thought into this. I'm, ah, listening intently.
Who's it going to be, Risha... the count, or me?
Have you made a decision?
I should examine your argument in more detail. Can we run through it again?
You know... crowns and thrones aren't that great. I could maybe live without them.
Assuming you survive me. I should kill you both for this insult!
Cool your thrusters. I don't see your name tattooed anywhere on me.
Calm down, Akaavi.
Me neither. And I checked. Thoroughly.
Don't do anything hasty! This isn't what it looks like, I swear!
Wait, I can explain!
Yes, it is. You have a problem with that?
You've seen how I fight. You really want to make this personal?
Try it and die.
Why does she even care about us? How is this an insult to her?
If you prefer this soft, passionless thing to me, then keep her. Otherwise, throw her out the air lock!
This doesn't mean you're out of the running, Akaavi. Risha may run off with some aristocrat.
That may not be necessary.
No man of honor treats women with such disrespect. You betray us both with your actions.
The count is suddenly looking a lot better.
Nothing's happened between me and Akaavi. It was just harmless flirtation. You know how I am.
Stay with me, Risha.
You're the one I've always wanted, Risha. Haven't I proved that yet?
If I misunderstood your interest in me, then I apologize. But you should be more careful with your tongue in the future.
Always good advice.
I think I've made my case. Not my fault you're upset over a little harmless flirtation.
Do whatever you want.
That's how it always starts, isn't it? Harmless. He's all yours, Mandalorian.
I find myself wanting him much less, now.
That's your problem, honey.
I never believed you'd stick around, anyway. At least Akaavi has fire in her.
In that case, I choose Akaavi.
Have fun burning together.
Akaavi, settle down. I'm not kicking anyone off this ship.
Sorry, Akaavi. I want Risha.
I didn't mean to lead you on. Risha's always been the girl for me. She always will be.
Your answer allows me to keep my honor. For this, I will let you both live.
Ugh! You and her? That's... exactly what I'd expect from you. What other "friendships" have you been keeping from me?
Aside from this, I've been a very good boy. Don't believe me, ask Corso.
None.
I'm glad there are only two women on this ship. I'll assume you don't have a thing for Mon Calamari.
I've woken up in some strange places, but it was usually after I'd been shot. Honest.
[Lie] None.
I'll just bet you're on a first-name basis with every cute med-tech on the Outer Rim.
How do you think I got so good at "arguing"? It takes practice, beautiful.
Lots.
Not another word. I mean it.
Nobody's going out the air lock. This is still my ship.
Go away, Risha. I want Akaavi.
Risha, it was fun while it lasted--but Akaavi's the one for me. What can I tell you? I like girls with big helmets.
I can't believe I let you kiss me! I need to be de-loused!
Or you could trade in this starship for a palace. What do you think?
I work best flying by the seat of my pants. You don't want me getting boring, do you?
Space is my place.
Definitely not. I think I've just made my choice even more complicated.
You're the only treasure I need. Everything else is pales in comparison.
[Flirt] I go where you go.
I'm not done talking to you.
Well... that was an enlightening discussion. I think I'm going to have to disappoint the count.
But first, I need some rest. Let's talk again later.
Get me my own throne and crown, and you've got a deal. Naturally, I'll expect to be left in charge of taxes.
It's good to be the king.
One thing at a time, your almost-highness. There's a lot to figure out.
We should probably cool things for a bit. I have some thinking to do.
I think I just talked myself out of wanting you.
I'm finished with you.
What? Why you... I knew this would happen!
For the record, I was only pretending to enjoy listening to you!
Sweetheart, women are lining up for me at every spaceport in the galaxy. I don't need to compete for you.
Our romance is over.
I wasn't asking you to... forget it. You've got an asteroid where your heart should be--or am I confusing that with your brain?
I was prepared for almost anything if it meant becoming queen: foiling assassination attempts, fighting wars, bunking on this ship for years... just kidding.
Marrying the count was never part of the plan. Can I really do that?
I'm trying to think of what I wouldn't do to become rich and powerful. Nope, I got nothing.
You asked the wrong person.
I've seen how your eyes wander every time we land on a new planet. You might get married, but could you stay that way?
Never back yourself into a corner, I always say. The count seems nice right now, but someday he'll be fat and old.
Maybe you shouldn't.
The med-techs on Dubrillion can work miracles. I've seen eighty year-olds passing for twenty. That's what I plan to do.
Your only job is to become queen. If marrying that nerf-herder gets you closer to the throne, do it.
Use him for all he's worth.
He'll make a popular king--maybe too popular. I don't want to look bad standing next to him.
Ugh, I hadn't even thought about producing heirs. Not that he wouldn't be a great... father.
This conversation's officially given me a headache. Let's go do something outrageous.
Count Rineld is a man of his word. He sends me daily updates about his rebellion's progress. Incredibly sweet, beautifully-written updates.
I knew taking Dubrillion's throne would be a challenge, but this is getting complicated.
I'm not falling for him, but I might have to take this marriage proposal seriously. It's smart politics.
Rationalize all you want. You'd still be choosing to spend your life with him.
If you say so.
This isn't just a business decision. I could be saving innocent lives.
If you think I'm letting some wealthy pretty boy come between us, guess again.
[Flirt] Blast the politics.
Don't you get it? My whole future will be spent with wealthy pretty people.
Nobles sleep in separate rooms, right? You can always slip me the key to your private chambers. I promise I'll be discreet.
We can still have fun.
I'm trying to imagine a universe where anything you do is "discreet."
When I'm queen, my days of racing the hyperlanes are over. Can you honestly see yourself settling down on Dubrillion?
Merritt's every bit the man he appears to be. Even the dirt I've dug up on him turned out clean.
It's "Merritt" now, huh? Sounds like you two are getting downright chummy.
You're falling for him.
He keeps insisting I not refer to him so formally. It's cute.
I can't wait to hear what skeletons are rattling around his royal closet.
What did you learn?
He stole the crown jewels when he was five. Got a slap on the wrist, and he's been clean ever since. Seriously.
If you haven't found anything, you're not looking deep enough.
Dig harder.
The count may be the most loved man on the planet. His enemies can't say enough nice things about him.
Nothing about this guy triggers warning bells. When it comes to husbands, I could do a lot worse.
I'll stop bothering you. I needed to talk, and you're the only person who understands me.
I'm always here if you need me.
Anytime, Risha.
Does your new boyfriend understand you like I do? Because if he doesn't, you should think about that.
[Flirt] What about the count?
He's not my boyfriend.
How honest have you been with your new boyfriend? Does he know all about your past?
What about the count?
I tried to tell him. He said it didn't matter who I used to be. It's the nicest thing anyone's ever said to me.
Me listening to you babble doesn't mean I comprehend any of it.
I don't understand you at all.
It's still better than talking to a bulkhead. Or Corso.
I'm sure there's trouble somewhere with our name on it. What do you say we go take all its credits?
You're back. How'd it go with the count?
Never talked to a complete stranger for that long before. Count Rineld gives to charities, builds orphanages, creates wildlife preserves--and those are just his hobbies.
You ever consider we've been wasting our lives?
I do everything for one reason: to get rich. It's straightforward, easy to remember and works amazingly well most of the time.
Maybe you have--but not me.
Ah, the simple life. Anyway, I left the negotiations open.
I knew it! He pulled every smooth maneuver in the flight manual.
You're falling for him.
That's the thing--he wasn't smooth. He was actually kind of awkward. Stop being so paranoid.
Somebody's got a crush on "Count Nice Guy."
You're falling for him.
He is nice--but I'm not rushing into anything.
I've definitely been wasting my time. The nanosecond you find some blue-blood stuffed shirt, you're ready to abandon ship.
Every second I'm with you.
That was always our deal--and it's not like I said "yes" to him.
I told the count I needed time to think about his proposal. That'll give me a chance to run a deep background check.
If this guy is as good as he seems, he just might help me overthrow the king without getting married....
Guess who found a potential accomplice in the Dubrillion aristocracy? Feast your eyes on this holo-embossed, genuine flimsiplast invitation.
See that fancy Aurebesh lettering? Hand-drawn. In ink. Classy.
"Count Merritt Rineld requests the favor of your presence at a discreet location in the Galactic Senate Tower on Coruscant, at a time of your choosing."
Coruscant? Why not Dubrillion?
Intriguing choice of location.
Coruscant is neutral ground. Meeting at the Senate Tower? That's a gesture of respect.
Does that invitation say why Baron Fancypants needs a face-to-face? Why can't he talk to you by holo?
He can't just call you?
Nobles are like gangsters: they won't crew with someone they've never met in person.
Pssh. Amateurs. Like we'd ever fall for something like that.
This is an obvious trap.
Nobody puts this much effort into a trap. Look at all the embossing. That took sincerity.
Count Rineld is one of the most popular nobles on Dubrillion. He's also secretly organizing a rebellion against the king.
His invitation is addressed to "Risha Drayen, Royal Heir to the Drayen Dynasty." He's taking me very seriously.
The count sounds like the kind of accomplice you need to overthrow the king.
Then meet with him.
I didn't think you were broadcasting your true identity.
You told him your real name?
I had no choice. "Risha from Nar Shaddaa" doesn't carry the same weight as "Risha the Future Queen."
Watch yourself. Best case scenario, he thinks he can use you for his agenda.
Don't trust him.
Well, obviously. The question is, can I use him back?
I'm contacting him by holo to arrange our meeting. Wanted you here to help me get a read on him. Opening a channel... whoa.
This is a tremendous moment, your Royal Heiress. I grew up hearing tales of the Drayen dynasty. The great battles your ancestors fought.
I never believed I'd meet a member of that proud bloodline in person. You have my deepest sympathies for your family's exile.
Risha wants back into Dubrillion politics. You can make that happen, right?
Help her return home.
From what I've seen, the Drayens earned a kick out the door.
They deserved it.
We don't have all day. Stop sucking up and get to the point.
Make your pitch, already.
You must be the starship captain who recovered the Crown of Dubrillion. My world is in your debt.
The king wants that crown--and my head. He won't be happy if he finds out we're talking.
The man has lost all reason. He must be removed from power, but in a way that spares our world a bloody civil war.
I believe the common people and aristrocracy alike would embrace the Drayen dynasty heir, especially if she wears the Crown of Dubrillion.
I doubt your current ruler will abdicate just because Risha has a better hat.
The king won't surrender.
The king's power base is already unstable. It will crumble under the right pressure.
Nothing is ever that easy. Skip to the part where our lives get complicated.
What's the catch?
It wasn't that long ago everyone wanted Risha's ancestor off the throne. What's changed?
Don't they hate the Drayens?
The early Drayen dynasty rulers are still highly-regarded. In historical retrospect, only the last one remains unpopular.
It will not be enough to de-throne the king. He must be replaced by someone the people view as one of their own.
Right now, you are an outsider. The only way to change that is to marry someone from the existing aristocracy.
Get married? To who?
Well, ahem, the only available suitor is... great stars, this is awkward... I am offering myself in marriage to you.
You sound a little nervous, count. Is your heart really in this?
Your proposal needs work.
Forgive my hesitance. I only feared insulting the lady with my abruptness. The circumstances are far from ideal.
This guy doesn't beat around the bantha. How do you want to play this?
What do you think, Risha?
You could've at least sent flowers, count.
Risha already has a man in her life.
Forget it, pal!
Forgive me... I should have realized. Have you two joined?
Er... not exactly, no.
Please understand, I do not desire to come between you. That said, the final choice should be yours.
Marrying Risha would make you king, wouldn't it? How convenient.
This is a big scam.
The Royal Heiress would hold primacy of power. I would be her subordinate in all matters.
I understand my proposal is abrupt, but I wished to make my intentions clear and not waste your valuable time.
I certainly don't expect an immediate response. All I ask is that you consider this for the good of Dubrillion.
That'll be easier to do once we've met in person. I'm on my way to Coruscant. See you there, count.
Well, that wasn't awkward at all.
That was the worst blind date ever. You've known this guy all of two minutes and he proposes marriage? Crazy.
It was too awkward.
This isn't romance. It's just politics.
The count was a lot nicer than most of the people we deal with.
He seemed sincere.
Hard to be sure over the holo, but I'm comfortable enough to meet him in person.
The nerve of that guy. Like you'd ever pick him over me.
You can't accept his proposal.
Don't get your thrusters overheated. It's good to have friends, that's all.
This whole deal smells like a bulk freighter of bantha droppings. No way should you trust that guy.
You shouldn't go to him.
Who said anything about trusting him?
Under the circumstances, I should probably take this meeting alone. Be back soon, Captain....
Been thinking about our decision to keep things casual. Thought I'd make sure you're still alright with it.
Why would you bring that up... unless you're having regrets?
Sounds like you have doubts.
No regrets. I'm just open to... course-correction.
In case you haven't noticed, I never stopped chasing you.
[Flirt] Was I ever?
We've been running a long time. That takes real stamina.
Uhm... yes? Or... no. What was the question?
I can't remember.
I've almost rendered you speechless. That's a first.
It could be years before I'm on Dubrillion's throne. Seems a shame to limit my options in the here and now.
You seem to know what I like. Heard of any opportunities I should explore?
Opportunities are my specialty--but I need to know exactly what you're looking for.
Be more specific.
Someone cool under pressure, but quick on the draw. Who understands business and knows how to take care of it. Ring any bells?
That's a tall order, but I might be able to fill it. What would you pay for something like that?
What are you offering?
My price is negotiable--but don't expect payment in advance.
I'm willing to start small and work my way up. I think you're worth it--and I know I am.
[Flirt] I can take it slow.
You drive a hard bargain, sweetheart. If I can fill your quota, I'll let you know.
I'll think about it.
You do that. But don't take too long.
You're more trouble than you're worth. I'd have better luck romancing a krayt dragon!
You're boring me.
Then maybe you should set course for Tatooine! It's almost mating season!
I know just the guy. He's practically a legend. You'd like him.
[Flirt] You bet it does.
Is that so? Keep talking.
I'd rather not.
You should look into that kid from Ord Mantell. He's about your speed. I hear he's nice to the ladies.
Corso is your man.
Thanks for the recommendation. I'll pass.
I suppose we should get back to letting people shoot at us.
There's only one Risha. I'll never settle for second best.
[Flirt] Just me.
I don't think you should either.
Good answer. I look forward to continuing this discussion later.
You think about what I said, and get back to me with a response.
[Flirt] Pick a time.
You can count on it.
Our conversation's just starting. I've got plenty more to say.
[Flirt] So do I.
We won't run out of things to talk about. Good to know.
We can't just stand here staring at each other. We have some exciting caper to pull off, don't we?
All I'm getting is one kiss? Taking it slow is one thing, but this is ridiculous!
We're already done? Insane!
I knew it. I give you a centimeter and you want a light year!
You kidding? You're higher-maintenance than a Rodian skip-trawler. At least those have resale value.
Nope.
You'd compare me to the most temperamental star freighters in the Outer Rim? That's low, even for you.
I am not high-maintenance. It just takes a steady hand to... why am I still using your idiot metaphor?
Forget it. Don't we have something better to do--preferably far away from each other?
The longer I spend here, the more it feels like home. I'm even starting to appreciate Corso. Must be coming down with something....
Promise me you'll visit often when I'm queen of Dubrillion.
I'll visit so often, you'll have to build an extra wing onto the palace.
Of course I will.
Why not? How about a private landing pad to go with it?
Aren't you afraid being friends with a common freighter captain will tarnish your reputation?
You're sure you want that?
First, there's nothing common about you. Second, the whole point of being queen is that I get to do whatever I want.
I'll try, but you know what this lifestyle's like. No rest for the wicked.
No promises.
Even the wicked need to stop and refuel. I'll cut you a friendly discount.
It'd be nice to sneak away with you for the occasional break. Go someplace dangerous, steal something expensive, mock the bad guys.
When you think about it, being queen of a planet provides the perfect alibi. We should take advantage of that.
You probably think I'm chasing Dubrillion's throne to get rich, don't you?
Credits are just a means to an end. You must want all that money for something.
For starters.
Your motives are your business. I don't judge.
It makes no difference to me.
All my father cared about was revenge. That isn't me.
You're a much more complicated woman than that.
[Flirt] No.
You think I'm complicated. But in a good way, right? Because I am. Complicated.
Who wouldn't want that high life? Having millions of subjects pay you to run their lives? You can sign me up anytime.
What other reason is there?
Ruling a planet is a big responsibility. One bad decision can hurt a lot of people.
I've seen what bad leadership does to a place. Alderaan... Nar Shaddaa... even Coruscant. They all suffer because of who's in power.
I'm not looking to plunder Dubrillion. I want to make it better. Run their society the right way.
I knew that mercenary attitude was a lie. You're a bleeding-heart do-gooder--admit it!
Ah-hah! You're a big softie!
Don't be ridiculous. I'm talking about political survival.
From everything I've heard about your homeworld, it could use someone decent in charge.
Sounds good to me.
Never thought of myself as "decent" before. Maybe I can sell that.
Let me tell you how that ends. Your subjects disagree with your good intentions. They revolt.
What a waste of time.
You have to crack down and restore order. Pretty soon, you're either executed... or a tyrant. The end.
Seriously, don't waste your time trying to help people. Take their taxes and let them live their lives.
You didn't let me finish. That's exactly what I'm planning.
Every successful leader has the same strength: they're perceived as generous by their subjects.
Give the people just enough of what they want, and they'll leave you alone. That's something the king of Dubrillion doesn't understand.
You can't give people what they want if you can't afford it. Maybe Dubrillion isn't as wealthy as you think.
Maybe he isn't rich enough.
It's wealthy enough to support an aristocracy. Of course, they need to get paid-off, too....
For a second, I thought I was seeing a whole new side of you. False alarm.
You're so cynical.
I'm just saying what everyone else is thinking. Nothing wrong with that.
You think the Sith Emperor worries about pleasing his people? He's still in power.
Fear is a better motivator.
Making people fear you is easy when you're a scary Sith. I don't have that luxury.
I can make this work. It's all about negotiation, and I'm good at that.
I'm just thinking out loud, now. We should get back to business....
Never thought I'd say this, but you're my favorite partner in crime. You make beating the odds look easy, Captain.
The secret is always fighting people who are dumber than me.
It is when you fight idiots.
That appears to be most of the galaxy. Never realized you were a genius.
That may be the biggest compliment you've ever paid me.
Thank you, Risha.
I like to mix a little praise with the insults. Keeps you off-balance.
What can I say? I'm inspired by a beautiful woman.
[Flirt] I'm motivated.
Just so we're clear, I had a snappy comeback for that line--but I'm not using it out of respect.
It would look even easier if I wasn't saving your neck all the time.
You make it twice as hard.
Oh, I'm your handicap? I don't think so.
I've definitely learned a few dirty tricks from watching you work. Think I might've found a few of my own.
We'll find out at our next death-defying showdown. I can't wait.
I notice we're spending a lot of time together. I'm not complaining, but... you know this can't go anywhere, right?
Sooner or later, I have to leave your ship. I don't want any hard feelings when I do. Does that make sense?
Hard feelings? You've barely given me the time of day.
We haven't even kissed.
Exactly. Why form a messy attachment if we're just going to split up later?
We'll have fun while it lasts, and no regrets when it's done. Perfect. Thank you, Captain.
I'd rather regret you for the rest of my life than get scared off by your crazy talk.
[Flirt] Not even a little.
There's just no reasoning with you. Have it your way.
If you want to make something of... whatever it is we have, fine. But don't say I didn't warn you.
Plenty of gorgeous ladies are lining up for me, sweetheart. Take a number, and I'll get to you. Eventually.
I have lots of other women.
I don't want to be "gotten to," you ridiculous... Never mind. We're at the same coordinates.
Let's go back to doing what we're good at: shooting people and making money.
My search for allies in Dubrillion's aristocracy has been interesting. Got an offer from a lesser baron. What a piece of work.
Guy must think I'm an idiot. Took two minutes to verify he's a spy for the king. He was baiting me into a trap.
Glad you caught wise before it went any further. I'm in no mood for another Tatooine.
That could have been trouble.
Look on the bright side. At this rate, the king will run out of assassins within the year.
If the information was that easy to find, maybe the baron's being set up?
Are you sure?
My sources are solid. The king keeps underestimating my intelligence. I'd feel sorry for him if he wasn't trying to kill me.
Know what I like to do with traps? Turn them against whoever set them.
Let's teach him a lesson.
Just one more thing we have in common.
I sent the spy a phony meeting request from Nar Shaddaa. He's sending "friends" to help me. They're in for a surprise.
Couple of Hutts owe me a favor. They promised to record the whole thing. I'll send the king a copy.
If I'm going to take over Dubrillion, I can't keep looking for allies in the same old places.
The scum of the galaxy isn't as useful when you're stealing a throne. I need a better class of accomplices.
You can't steal anything big without some corrupt officials on your payroll.
You need politicians.
No matter what you're stealing, you can always use a little scum to grease the works.
Criminals have their uses.
I already have that covered, Captain. You're worth a hundred normal scum. And I mean that in the nicest way.
You're gonna need a new wardrobe. You dress like Nar Shaddaa smells.
Good luck attracting them.
Oh, like I'd take fashion tips from you. Besides, I already have some promising new leads.
There are some interesting rumors out of Dubrillion. Turns out the aristocracy is unhappy with the king. Some nobles are secretly rebelling.
Taxes are the leading cause of rebellions. I bet that's the problem.
That king sure is unpopular.
You have such a wonderfully simple view of politics. It terrifies me how often you're right.
Hating the king is one thing. Putting you on the throne is something else.
But would they support you?
The point is, the planet's politics are ripe for change. All I have to do is personify that.
Get those idiots to wipe each other out. They'll leave you a nice big power vacuum to fill.
Pit them against each other.
I don't want to inherit an empty treasury--or a blood feud.
Dubrillion is turning into another Alderaan. A new queen could prevent that, assuming she had the aristocracy's support.
But that means taking this game to a new level. You up for that?
You're the one steering the ship. I'm just along for the ride.
You're the boss.
That's not exactly true, but thanks for the vote of confidence. That was confidence, right?
Don't expect me to be a politician. I solve most problems by shooting them.
Just remember who I am.
There's a time and place for everything. If someone tries to kill me, feel free to shoot them.
I'm not leaving until you're sitting pretty on that throne. And not even then.
[Flirt] Always.
I'll have to find you a political appointment. Maybe something in sanitation.
I've dealt with Hutts. A bunch of prancing nobles doesn't scare me.
I'm over-qualified.
What if we have to prance with them? Do you even own prancing shoes?
I've put out feelers to some key Dubrillion nobles. When one of them bites, be ready to pounce.
In the meantime, we have plenty of other business to keep us occupied.
Seems like I've been doing all the talking lately. Makes me suspicious.
The biggest drawback of the criminal lifestyle is, you don't meet a lot of decent men. Most are long on charm, short on substance.
What's underneath that charming exterior, Captain? Or is that all you've got?
You know the Spacer's Motto, sweetheart: "If I don't have it, I can get it." What are you in the market for?
What more do you need?
I'm not buying, I'm selling. And the Seller's Motto is: "If you have to ask the price, you probably can't afford it."
I've learned the hard way never to jump into things. There's a lot I don't know about you.
Maybe I just didn't want to bore you with personal details. You want to know more about me? Ask away.
[Flirt] Find out.
You're a mercenary who takes jobs for free. How do you plan to stay in business, Captain Goodheart?
I always have credits to keep flying. The rest is spending-money.
I earn more than enough.
So you're nice to people out of laziness? I don't buy it.
I'm looking to settle down with a nice girl of independent means. Know anybody like that?
[Flirt] By marrying wealth.
At least you're honest.
There are a lot of bad people in this galaxy with too many credits. I plan to relieve them of that burden.
Stealing from the evil.
I can't tell if that's your career or your hobby.
I've seen how you do business. You aren't known for your loyalty.
I'm always loyal to someone. It just may not be the first person I talk to.
Sure I am.
Point of view is everything.
I'm loyal to the people who matter. That's you, Risha.
[Flirt] I'm loyal to you.
You're sweet... or maybe you just haven't had a better offer yet.
I give as a good as I get. If people want my loyalty, they have to give me theirs first.
Loyalty is earned, not given.
We have more in common than I thought.
You're a hard man to figure out. Sometimes you play the hero. Sometimes not.
Predictability gets you killed. I like to keep the opposition guessing.
It's a survival tactic.
Is that how you see me? The "opposition"? Thought we were partners.
What's worse, that you can't figure me out, or that I might not be a hero?
That bothers you?
I've had my share of heroes. They can be unreliable, too.
When I play the hero, it's business. If playing the villain pays better, so be it.
All depends on the reward.
Then you're a pure mercenary. Good to know.
I won't lie. I enjoy spending time with you. But I'm not like other girls. The easy lines are wasted on me.
If that doesn't scare you off, maybe this will actually go somewhere. I guess we'll see.
I don't show you anything else because I don't trust you. Probably never will.
It's all I have for you.
Guess I know where we stand. Thanks for the map.
I'm reviewing holovids of Dubrillion. Beautiful planet. Amazing oceans and forests. One of these days I'll have to see it in person.
Why wait? Give me the coordinates. I'll have us there by dinnertime.
We could go now.
Throttle down, Captain. Don't you think I'd have visited by now if I could?
How can you be sure the planet's even worth ruling? For all you know it smells like a wet bantha.
You've never been there?
I hire Bothan spies to pose as tourists and record everything for me. Even the smells.
Preferably, you'll see it from the royal palace--while standing on the king's corpse.
And rule it with an iron fist.
Not like he doesn't have it coming.
Father warned me to stay away from that planet before he went into hibernation. The spaceport has genetic scanners keyed to the Drayen bloodline.
The king's doing everything in his power to keep me away. I'm not taking over without inside help. Until then, I have the holovids.
I envy you, Captain. You'll always be free to do as you please. That all changes for me, once I'm a queen.
I thought the whole point of ruling a planet was to do whatever you feel like.
But you'll be in charge.
My ancestors tried that. Didn't work out.
Dubrillion is getting along fine without you. Do what makes you happy.
So don't become one.
Ruling a planet has its perks. I should at least give it a try.
Freedom is overrated, sweetheart. I'd rather buy a nice planet somewhere. Retire with the woman of my dreams.
[Flirt] I want to settle down.
Dream woman, huh? Good thing you've got a vivid imagination.
You'll be surrounded by people waiting on you hand and foot. My heart bleeds, Risha. Honest.
I have no sympathy.
Servants have a habit of becoming traitors if they're not treated well.
I've studied records about the Drayen dynasty. They started from humble beginnings, distinguished themselves as war heroes. Officially, anyway.
In reality, they backstabbed their way to power just like every other ruler. Some were better at it than others.
Why didn't Nok make his own play for the throne? He was king of the backstab.
What about your father?
He knew recovering the crown was essential to establishing legitimate rule. It's not enough to conquer a world. You have to hold it, too.
If they'd been able to hold onto power, you'd already be Queen.
They all failed.
It only takes one bad ruler to topple a dynasty. And my great-grandfather was good at burning bridges.
You'll be Queen in no time. You're the best backstabber I know.
In that case, you'll do great.
Thanks, but I'm looking to do things a little differently.
Father had his failings, but he inspired loyalty. Whenever he defeated a rival gangster, he always freed the enemy slaves.
He gave them a choice: join him or take their chances elsewhere. No recriminations for anyone who left. The rest became family.
I don't think Nok's definition of "family" is the same one in the dictionary.
Family may be overdoing it.
He gave them regular meals, shelter, and a chance to make their own fortunes.
Interesting way to recruit new talent. How many slaves actually signed-on?
How many joined him?
Those people had a lot of anger issues. Most were excited to have a job that let them express it.
There's no way your father just let the slaves go. He had them killed while you weren't looking.
That isn't the Nok I know.
You don't get it. He never needed to hurt them. Most slaves joined him. The rest were weak--no threat.
There was this one little Twi'lek girl who joined us. Best thief I ever met. Got into all sorts of trouble together.
We were like sisters, but when father's organization collapsed we got separated. I never found out what happened to her.
No news is good news. She's probably enjoying an early retirement somewhere.
I'm sure she's fine.
I like to think so.
Never too late to find her. If she's as good a thief as you say, she might come in handy.
You should look her up.
That was a long time ago. Sometimes it's better to leave the past alone.
If you haven't heard from her by now, you're not going to.
She's probably dead.
She was always a survivor. I like to think she started over, like me.
You're really bringing out my chatty side today. That usually means I need to get some exercise.
Let's find something more exciting to do than stand around.
I think I've figured out why we get along so well, Captain. We're both restless people. It's how we survive.
Trouble loves us, and we just keep on moving. Eventually, trouble gets tired of following and gives up.
There's always more trouble where that came from.
But not for long.
Exactly. Isn't it wonderful?
I've attracted some awfully persistent trouble.
Never in my experience.
Some people are lucky that way.
I'm the kind of trouble that never gets tired. Do yourself a favor, sweetheart--stop running.
[Flirt] Let trouble catch you.
I don't have to run from you, Captain. A brisk walk is usually enough.
I have no idea what you're talking about. Have you been inhaling fuel-line cleaners again?
You're babbling.
Maybe you're some kind of "trouble savant." That would explain a lot.
There wasn't nearly enough trouble growing up on Dantooine. After being a crime lord's daughter, sitting around got dull real quick.
I had a big library of holo-recordings from my father, but I could only watch them so many times.
Never figured Nok for the sentimental type. He left you a bunch of holos dispensing his life's wisdom?
Tell me about the recordings.
If by "wisdom" you mean teaching me how to become a criminal, then yes. He was a good teacher. Very detail-oriented.
You still had a starship. I'm guessing you weren't long for Dantooine.
You ran away, right?
When things get dull, I just start shooting. Works like a charm.
I make my own trouble.
I tried that, but Kath hounds are so stupid. I never got them to chase me.
By the time I was fourteen, I'd had enough. I buried father's carbonite chamber someplace safe and hit the hyperlanes with a new identity.
Those were good times. I met Juran and Audila. Got mixed-up with Beryl Thorne. Lived a life of crime.
I'm sure Nok was proud of your accomplishments.
Just like your father.
Actually, he was disappointed I didn't have my own criminal empire. I was having too much fun on my own.
Every time I see some idiot scrubbing tables at a cantina, I think of how lucky I am.
That's the best way to live.
Normal jobs are for people who aren't smart enough to earn a real living.
As criminals go, you're pretty mediocre. You joined-up with Skavak, for crying out loud.
Not a very good one.
I never "joined-up" with Skavak. I used him until someone better came along. Worked out pretty well.
I'm starting to enjoy these chats, but I'm feeling restless. Let's go find some trouble.
Sometimes I can't believe you actually got back my crown. Do you know how many spacers died looking for it?
Don't take this the wrong way, but when we first met I thought you'd wind up like all the others.
I'll always beat the odds. You can count on that.
Not my style.
Why do you think I stayed with you? I'm hoping some of that luck rubs off.
That's why I stuck around. I need all the good luck I can get.
I never thought you had anything less than total confidence in me.
You hid it well.
I learned pretty fast not to underestimate you.
No wonder you wouldn't let yourself fall for me. You were afraid I'd die.
[Flirt] That explains it all.
Oh, yes. Terrified.
You probably planned to steal my ship when I died.
So you were using me?
Would that have been so wrong?
What I'm really saying is, thanks. I wouldn't be where I am without you.
I never leave an unhappy customer... except for Rogun the Butcher. He doesn't count.
It's all part of the job.
You can't please everyone.
You don't have to thank me, Risha. We're not business partners anymore.
What are friends for?
That's all the more reason to say something.
You owe me big time, future Queen. Don't think I'm not planning to collect.
Never forget it.
It's just business. Sure.
Anyway... didn't mean to slow us down. I'm sure we have plenty to do.
After an acceptable period of mourning.
You're all right, Captain. With a little polish, you just might shine.
I've been shining since you met me. You're just not paying attention.
[Flirt] I already shine.
Interesting theory. When you can prove it, let me know.
This polishing business sounds like fun. When do we start?
[Flirt] Polish away.
I wasn't volunteering, Captain. Just... observing.
Don't get your hopes up, Risha. You're not my type.
Not for you, I won't.
Wait, you thought I was flirting with you? Please! You're not my type, either.
I shouldn't be keeping us from our work. I know how busy we are.
Bet you were surprised to see I can hold my own in a fight. I'm pretty good with a blaster.
My father taught me to shoot when I was four years old.
Sounds like Nok didn't give you much of a childhood.
Most children play with toys.
Are you kidding? His lieutenants were terrified of me. They let me do whatever I wanted.
Was Nok that desperate for muscle?
What was the big rush?
He thought an armed toddler was more reliable than his own people.
He robbed me of my big chance. Teaching a girl to shoot can be romantic, if you do it right.
[Flirt] I wanted to do that.
And very messy if you don't. Maybe he spared you a visit to the med-center.
My kid will be born with a blaster in one hand and credits in the other.
I'll do the same, someday.
Ha... sorry, I was just imagining you with a child....
Father wanted me self-sufficient as early as possible. Said I'd need it to survive. He was right.
I still remember the day he told me he was "going to sleep" for a while. Said I was on my own.
Nok was in that carbonite for a decade. Weren't you still counting birthdays on one hand?
You must have been young.
Tell me he at least gave you credits before he froze himself in carbonite.
He just abandoned you?
He wasn't the greatest father in the galaxy, but he planned ahead. Gave me a blaster, a starship and plenty of credits.
"Going to sleep?" You must have thought he was dying.
I'll bet you were scared.
Oh, no. He always treated me like an adult. I knew what was happening, even if I didn't understand it.
I was eleven. Made my first solo hyperspace jump and flew to Dantooine. Father had a hideout there.
Talk about your one-bantha planets. For a few years, Dantooine's population was doubled thanks to me and father frozen in carbonite.
You had one messed-up childhood, Risha. It's a wonder you didn't come out crazy.
Sounds lonely... and weird.
You talk a lot about Nok, but you've never mentioned your mother.
What about your mother?
She died when I was young. I don't remember her.
Now I understand your lack of social graces. You were raised by a hunk of carbonite.
This explains your immaturity.
Having my verbal skills insulted by you... ironic.
Looking back, I should've been miserable. But it was just a big adventure.
Speaking of which, we're overdue for some more excitement. What do you say we get back to our latest caper?
When we get back to the ship, come find me. I need a few moments of your time.
Next time we're someplace we won't get shot, let's talk.
This isn't a good time for a chat. Maybe later.
You're the boss.
Looking forward to working with you, Captain.
I'll be fine. I'm always fine.
Glad to know you've got my back.
I hope you know what you're doing.
You're easily distracted by shiny things, aren't you?
I promise you won't be disappointed.
I won't let you take off without me.
There's nowhere in Republic space that's safe anymore.
Normal jobs are for people who aren't smart enough to earn a real living.
Let's find something more exciting to do than stand around.
I'd wish you good luck, but I know you don't need it.
I suppose we should get back to letting people shoot at us.
Let's go back to doing what we're good at: shooting people and making money.
I'm taking a wild guess that my life just got a new kind of complicated.
